meanings.sent1: The sunlight petered out as the day turned to night.
meanings.sent2: Her enthusiasm for the project petered away as time passed.
meanings.sent3: The supply of snacks petered out just when the movie started.
meanings.sent4: His patience finally petered out after waiting for hours.
meanings.sent5: The river's flow petered to a gentle trickle by the end of summer.

meanings.definition: To come to an end; exhaust
meanings.sent1: The music petered out as the party came to a close.
meanings.sent2: Their energy petered out after a long day of hiking.
meanings.sent3: The jokes petered out, leaving an awkward silence in the room.
meanings.sent4: The road seemed to peter out into the vast desert ahead.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd petered out as the final whistle blew.
